column4:
Salt water lightly.
Bring a large pot of water to a boil.
Add ziti pasta.
Cook until al dente (about 8 minutes ).
Drain.
In a large skillet fry onion and ground beef over medium heat.
Add spaghetti sauce and mushrooms.
Simmer 15 minutes.
Counter with a 9x13 baking dish or casserole dish.
Layer half of the ziti in a baking dish.
In a small bowl, mix together the sour cream and cottage cheese until blended.
Pour half the meat sauce mixture over the ziti.
Lay the provolone cheese slices over the meat sauce.
Spread sour cream/ cottage cheese mixture over provolone slices.
Spread remaining ziti.
Top with remaining meat sauce mixture.
Shred mozzarella cheese.
Top with mozzarella cheese.
Preheat oven to 25 degrees F.
Bake for 30 minutes or until cheeses are melted and the top starts to brown.

In a large bowl, beat the sugar and vegetable oil using an electric mixer to blend.
Lightly grease two (5x9 foot) loaf pans.
Add the eggs, one at a time, then add the vanilla, mixing after each addition.
Add the bananas to combine.
Stir to combine.
In another large bowl, whisk together fluids, cinnamon, baking soda, baking powder, and salt.
Stir flour mixture into the banana mixture until just combined, 2 or 3 times.
Spoon batter evenly into and fill each loaf pan about 3/4 way to the top of each pan.
Gently fold in blueberries.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Insert toothpick in the middle of the loaf.
Bake in oven for 60-70 minutes or until the toothpick comes out clean.
During the summer, a wire rack loaf pan that will cool for 10 minutes.
Remove the pan from its original shape.
Place the pan on a shelf.
Let cool completely.

Pull the leaves off the cauliflower and cut out the core in a kind of cone-shaped section.
Break or cut the florets into small, regular pieces (about 1 1/2 inch) and put them in the steamer insert.
Bring about 1 inch of water to a boil in the steamer pot, add the insert, cover, and cook for about 20 minutes, or until you can poke a paring knife into the stems and you can feel that there 's still a little texture there.
Dump about half of the cauliflower into a food processor.
Pour in the nut milk and purée until smooth.
Now dump the rest of the cauliflower on top and purée again.
You 'll need to stop and scrape and stir the purée a few times.
Once smooth, add in the butter, salt, pepper and garlic and mix.
Taste for seasoning and serve hot.
(You can reheat over low heat in the same pan if you 're not eating immediately.).

Use a stand mixer with the paddle attachment.
In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda, baking powder and salt.
Beat the butter, cream cheese, light brown sugar, granulated sugar and vanilla extract until the mixture becomes light and fluffy.
Add eggs one at a time, making sure they are fully incorporated.
Add the dry mixture a third at a time until mixed.
Incorporated, scrape down the sides as needed.
Stir in the chocolate chips.
Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Use a cookie scoop.
Place 1-2 tablespoon mounds onto the parchment paper about 2 inches apart.
Preheat oven to 350°.
Bake the cookies for 12-14 minutes or until golden brown.
Remove from oven.
And let cool for 5 minutes.
Before transfer to a cooling rack.
Minutes before bake.
For best results, place dough in refrigerator overnight or for at least 30 minutes.

In a small pan roast the coriander, cumin, seeds, cardamom, cinnamon, and cloves separately.
Once the cloves start to smell fragrant, turn each one on a plate to cool.
Roast the cloves.
Strip the cards and use only the seeds.
Strip the cards and discard the seeds.
Put all the cards in an electric blender.
All the cards blend the cards into a fine powder.
Greased the nutmeg finely.
Mix the nutmeg finely.
Store the nutmeg in an airtight glass jar.

In the bowl of a stand mixer, combine yeast, water, salt, oil, and 2 cups flour.
Mix on 2 speed for about 1 minute using dough hook.
Add remaining flour 1/2 cup at a time until dough clings to hook and sides of bowl are clean.
Continue wringing at a mass for 2 additional minutes.
Place dough in an oil bowl (I often use the bowl I remove and then return to as a stand mixer) and turn to oil on top.
Cover with towel or plastic wrap.
This recipe can be divided into 4 pieces to make a smaller thin crust Tuesday or 2 pieces to make a larger medium thick crust Tuesday.
Place in a warm place to rise for an hour.
Make pizza according to your favorite direction.

Fry slow.
Place chicken in slow-cooker.
Top with pepper and carrot.
In a separate bowl combine broth ingredients including orange juice, soy sauce, brown sugar, mustard, and garlic salt from the southwestern.
Pour over chicken.
Cover on low.
Cook on low for 6-7 hours.
Remove chicken and vegetables from the slow cooker.
Keep warm.
Boil sauce.
Take out 1 cup of cooking liquid.
Bring to a boil in a saucepan.
Stir together 1 tbsp.
Add the orange juice and cornstarch to the sauce.
Stir for 2-3 minutes until thick.
Pour in chicken.
Slice green vegetables.
Top with green vegetables.
Cook rice.
Serve over rice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees, and grease a loaf pan.
In a large mixing bowl, add flour, oats, salt, cinnamon, pumpkin pie spice, and baking powder.
Stir to combine.
In another mixing bowl, beat the eggs with an electric hand mixer and then add the sugar.
Beat until well combined.
Add the oil, yogurt, pumpkin, and vanilla and beat to mix well.
Fold the mini chips into the batter.
Pour into the loaf pan and bake for 1 hour, or until a toothpick inserted into the middle comes out clean.

Place chicken, tomatoes, enchilada sauce, onion, green chiles and garlic in slow cooker.
Pour in water and chicken broth with cumin, chili powder, salt, pepper and bay leaf.
Water and season.
Stir in corn and cilantro.
Cover.
And cook on low for 6-8 hours or on high 3-4 hours.
Brush tortillas (both sides) with oil.
Cut tortillas into strips on baking sheet.
Strips and place.
Preheat oven to 400°.
Bake until crisp, about 10-15 minutes.
Sprinkle tortilla strips on top of soup.
To serve.

In a large mixing bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, salt, and sugar.
In a jug measure the milk.
Separate the eggs.
Place the eggs whites in the bowl of the stand mixer.
Add the yolk and vanilla essence to the milk.
Whisk together the yolk and vanilla essence.
Pour it into the flour mixture.
It stir it very gently until about combined.
Melt butter.
Stir butter into it.
Continue to mix butter very gently until combined.
Beat in to egg whites until stiff.
Preheat waffle iron.
Slowly fold in to batter the egg whites.
Sever the batter by batch onto the waffle iron.
Cook the egg whites according to your directions.
Remove the egg whites immediately.
Serve the maple syrup and fruit.

Add the flour mixture and mix on low speed just until blended .
Transfer the dough onto a piece of plastic wrap and wrap tightly .
In a medium bowl , whisk together both flours , the baking soda and salt .
When ready to bake the cookies , preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
Refrigerate for at least 2 hours , or up to 5 days .
Bake for another 6 to 8 minutes , or until the cookies are dark golden brown .
Line two baking sheets with parchment paper or a silicone baking mat .
Store in an airtight container for up to 5 days .
Bake the cookies for 10 minutes and then rotate the baking sheet .
Let cool for a minute on the baking sheets , then transfer to a cooling rack .
Transfer to the baking sheet.
On a lightly floured surface , roll out the dough and cut into 3-inch squares .
Let cool completely ( they will crisp up as they cool ) .
In a large bowl , combine the butter , brown sugar and honey .

First four ingredient in a large mixing bowl combine well-combined.
Evenly spreading a 9x13 baking dish.
Combine ingredients for the peanut butter bar chocolate topping medium glass bowl.
Melt and in the microwave for 1 minute at a time.
From remove the microwave and stirred until smooth.
Spread of the peanut butter bar base.
Place in the freezer for 15 minutes.
Removes from the freezer.
Cut into individual bars.
The size depending on number of bars like you serve (20-36 bars).
